me parece muy increÃ­ble la calidad de los grÃ¡ficos para la epoca (1998), el canon de la historia se presenta como algo que pude tener posibilidad de suceder en la vida real, por otra parte la modalidad de juego resulta ser un poco entorpecedora para un shooter en especial con el cÃ³mo elegir las armas ya que Half-life dispone de muchas armas (incluidas las cuerpo a cuerpo) y ya que no existe una tecla clave para seleccionar entre armas debemos recurrir al teclado numÃ©rico, lo que dificulta seleccionar el arma apropiada en el momento de combates claves, en las habilidades del personaje destaco la asombrosa resistencia debidos al traje de protecciÃ³n y los hiperimpulsos o saltos largos, en lo que concierne a la historia como ya dije antes resulta ser interesante dado que con los avances cientÃ­ficos no descarto la posibilidad de que pueda ocurrir algo asi en la vida real "la realidad supera a la ficciÃ³n siendo esta una copia barata de la anterior" la historia es muy envolvente dado que estÃ¡ llena de incertidumbre y curiosidad, el final me costÃ³ un poco entenderlo pero logre extractar lo mejor de este juego 

-Modalidad de juego:  shooter en primera persona, supervivencia, acciÃ³n, ciencia ficciÃ³n  

-Mi calificaciÃ³n: 9.5/10

-Recomendado: al 100 x 100

-GrÃ¡ficos: excelentes para la epoca 

-Multijugador: 5/10

-Calidad en el modo de juego (controles, Ã­temsâ€¦): excelente

-historia: excelente

Un juego bastante entretenido y con una Ãºnica historia. He de decir, que al jugarlo, he sentido escalofrios en algunos momentos. Lo que no me gusta del todo, es que una campaÃ±a de 11 horas, para una historia tan corta. El juego tiene una serie de puzles, unos mas dificiles que otros, lo cual lo hace mas dificil, pero nunca imposible. Y lo mejor es pasarselo sin mirar ningun tipo de ayuda, la alegria al completarlo al final es mucho mas satisfactoria. Me ha gustado bastante, y cuando pude pasarmelo sentÃ­ un alivio muy grande.

Ah, Half-Life....

Playing this game is like experiencing an amazing piece of our culture and history.... 
but this time you won't fall a sleep like in the class.

Shame that they don't make First Person Shooters like this anymore.

Also hands down Xen is the best final level from any old school First Person Shooter.
Platforming, visuals, puzzles, enemies, portals, boss fights. 
Ah, a perfect way to end such classic game.
Great game. Still holds up after 20-ish years. Not graphically, of course, but gameplay wise.

Un analisis sobre Half-Life estÃ¡ de mÃ¡s, sobretodo en 2018. Ya todo sobre esta joya estÃ¡ dicho. Half-Life es un clasico, un juego que llego para revolucionar tanto el genero como la industria en general,  y quÃ© bien lo hizo la verdad. El argumento del juego es buenisimo, y el final nos deja con ganas de mÃ¡s, la curiosidad de saber quien es ese extraÃ±o sujeto con traje y quÃ© fue lo que paso luego de elegir nuestra desiciÃ³n final. La jugabilidad es muy buena, incluso a dÃ­a de hoy aÃºn lo es, las mecanicas son buenisimas, la forma es la que interactuamos con los mapas, ya sea para descubrir zonas secretas o simplemente para seguir avanzando, los sonidos y el soundtrack del juego son buenisimos, los personajes iconicos, el doblaje a pesar de no ser el mejor es muy gracioso xdd, y la curva de dificultad es genial, no nos hace sentir alguien invensible, incluso muchas veces hay que pensar dos veces lo que vamos a hacer.

Half-Life es una obra maestra, un juego que no debe faltar en tu biblioteca por nada del mundo, muy recomendado, de lo mejor que podras jugar. 11/10.

Increible lo de este juego. Pasa el tiempo y sigue estando bueno jugarlo. Mas que nada por que no es el tipico fps mata-mata tipo cod o Doom. Es un juego con muchos puzzles que te hacen pensar y fases de plataformas. El diseÃ±o de los niveles es genial. Cada zona de Black Mesa es diferente. Lo unico que no me gusta de este juego es Xen. Se me hace muy pesada esa parte y eso que es bastante corta. Obviamente lo recomiendo, aunque les diria que si pueden juegen mejor al Black Mesa (el remake hecho con los graficos de half life 2) mas que nada por los graficos y ciertos cambios que le aÃ±adieron.

A physicist has a hysterical breakdown caused by a blast of gamma radiation which damages his brain, causing him to hallucinate that the facility has been overrun by alien creatures. He proceeds to then massacre his friends and colleagues believing they are 'space monsters'. 

At least that's what I assumed happened. I've never gotten to the end.

This game has all of the ingredients for a first rate shooting experience: varied environments, great level design, an abundance of enemy and weapon types, and an interesting narrative. Unfortunateky though, it didn't click with me. Combat is extremely bland and many of the fights feel cheap. Platforming is the primary focus of the last few levels and doing so in first person shooters is rarely (has it ever?) done well, and this game is no exception. It manages to be less than the sum of its parts, and I doubt I play the sequel. 

Do I recommend it? Yes, even if my review argues the opposite. If you're more into the adventure side of things this will surely hit all the right buttons, but I'm more of a "shoot first, ask questions never (because I don't care)" kind of person. I am glad I played it, even if only so that I understand the infinite amount of references in games released after this one.
honestly best game i have ever played

Never had the chance to play this game when it was new due to system requirements, so when I saw this on the steam sale for .99 cents...I had to pick it up.  The graphics may be outdated, but the story and game play are excellent.  I would recommend to anyone who hasn't played it to pick it up the next time it goes on sale.

Un gran juego y una gran entrega original, en donde tendremos que tomar el papel de un cientifico llamado Gordon Freeman.
La historia del juego comienza con nosotros llegando a una central llamada Black Mesa para trabajar ya que nos contrataron para hacer experimentos con un cristal extraÃ±o. Luego de intentar, el experimento falla y se abre una brecha espacio-temporal, permitiendo que muchos alienigenas lo penetren y asesinen a muchos cientificos. Nuestra principal misiÃ³n es sobrevivir y escapar de Black Mesa.

Este juego es un clÃ¡sico con todas las palabras, la joya mayor de Valve. 10/10

Everyone should play through this game at least once, whilst everything in the game no longer seems like that big of a deal it was the best of it's time for a reason. I was so suprised by how well everything holds up. I expected a clunky, blurry mess but the graphics have't aged all that badly and the controls are spot on. It's 10 hours long and worth every penny.

Have fun.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JoV9o6b91Sc

As a fan of old-school FPS titles, I knew that I had to get around to Half-Life at some point.

I'm glad I did.

While old, the game still plays very well, with traditional high movement speed and platforming that went over a lot better than I expected (though still not always perfect). The puzzle-solving elements are fun, even if a tad frustrating at times, and it is very rewarding to discover the solution to something that seemed so impossible beforehand.

The atmosphere and escalation of tension throughout the game is fantastic. The world is lively, well-crafted, and the twists and turns that occur thoughout the game are enough to keep someone on edge the whole time, especially during the final act.

My main complaints come in with the combat. Unfortunately, I played through my first time on Hard mode, and realized how much I appreciate DOOM's projectile-based enemies over the more modern hitscan threats. Enemy soldiers have remarkable AI, and can kill you in seconds with barrages of undodgeable rifle rounds and volleys of grenades. Vortigaunts are essentially Shamblers from Quake, but are harder to hit and eventually come in droves to kill you from a distance. Actually, I noticed that hit registration was a bit off during several parts of the game, and found myself often doubting whether or not I could even protect myself. Also, completing the last four levels ended up being one of the most difficult challenges I have ever faced in any video game.

All that said, on Normal mode, the game is fine, and I highly recommend that you play it if you haven't. I may even wager that I enjoyed this game more than the sequel, if only for the interesting enemies, cunning AI, and twist towards the end of the game.
